item.title: Convex, Strongly Convex, Concave, Strongly Concave
item.description: We list some properties and inequalities of convexity, strongly-convexity, concavity, strongly-concavity Convexity. The following definitions are equivalent. We say $f:S\subset \mathbb{R}$ is convex if $f(\theta x+ (1-\theta)y)\leq \theta f(x)+(1-\theta) f(y)$ for all $x,y\in S$ and $0\leq \theta \leq 1$ $f(y)-f(x)\geq \langle\nabla f(x),y-x\rangle$
